benchmark_details.name: TEIDAN corpus
benchmark_details.overview: The TEIDAN corpus is a novel, spontaneous, and multi-modal multi-party dialogue corpus designed to facilitate research on triadic dialogue systems, focusing on addressee recognition.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a foundational resource for the development of advanced multi-party dialogue systems capable of effectively managing complex conversations.

data.source: Data collected from 10 triads discussing various topics in a controlled environment with recorded visual and audio.
data.annotation: Annotators labeled turns for addressees based on explicit cues and contextual visual information.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy was calculated as the ratio of correctly identified addressees to the total identified cases.
methodology.interpretation: An accuracy score above chance level indicates some understanding of addressee recognition in dialogues.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o achieved an accuracy of 80.9% for addressee recognition, only marginally above chance.
methodology.validation: Results were validated through comparative performance analysis on the tasks of addressee recognition and next speaker prediction.
